quest.name: City of the First
journal: The Crystal Exarch has a request for you.
objectives: Attune to the aetheryte in the Crystarium.
Speak with Katliss in the Crystalline Mean.
Speak with Moren in the Cabinet of Curiosity.
Speak with Bragi at Musica Universalis.
Find the Crystal Exarch near the Exedra and present your findings.

dialogue.name: GARLONDMAN03279
dialogue.text: I've been keeping that device you uncovered safe and sound. Did you need to use it again...?

dialogue.name: Q0
dialogue.text: Touch the beacon and travel to the First?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Now, a full and frank discussion in the privacy of my study would seem to be in order...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: ...But I think our conversation would be more meaningful were you first to gain a firmer grasp of the situation here.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: To that end, I would like you to visit a few of the Crystarium's civic leaders, and glean something of this world and its predicament.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: As you can see, this path will take you directly to the aetheryte─a convenience with which I am sure you are only too familiar.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Being the rightful object of my summoning spell, you should in theory be able to reach all the way back along your aetheric trail and find a connection in the Source, believe it or not.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: I strongly suggest you complete this attunement before venturing any further.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: After you have done so, walk up the steps next to the aetheryte and head out to the left to arrive in the Crystalline Mean. This is where you'll find our collective of crafters and gatherers, as well as their spokeswoman, Katliss─one of the people I should like you to meet.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Another is Moren. To reach him and his “Cabinet of Curiosity,” you'll want to avoid the aforementioned steps, take the exit on the left, and simply continue straight along and down until you come to the large doors at the end of the path.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: The third and final person I should like you to meet is Bragi, our man in charge of trade and distribution. He is to be found in the markets, which you can access from the opposite side of the aetheryte plaza.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: In seeking out each of my colleagues, you will visit the major districts of the city, and hopefully gain a feel for the place. I trust my directions were simple enough?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Crystal clear.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: To the right and down the where now...?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Hah, very good. I concede, the layout of the Crystarium owes more to historic necessity than planning, but I'm sure you'll learn its twists and turns before long.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: My apologies. I forget how confusing the Crystarium can be for newcomers. Not to worry! I'm sure you'll soon become accustomed to its twists and turns.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: ...In all honesty, the true challenge may be in finding the right way to approach its citizens.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: As you discovered during your encounter with the captain, the people of this world are unaware of the existence of other stars, and will struggle to accept the truth of your origin.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: That being the case, when they ask whence you hail─as they inevitably will─I suggest you claim to share a homeland with the Crystal Exarch. There is an unspoken rule here about peering too deeply into that particular mystery.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: When you've finished making the rounds, pray meet me in the large courtyard at the center of town. Until then.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: The attunement worked as hoped, I trust? Any trouble finding my three colleagues?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Remember: starting from the aetheryte, go up the steps and to the north to find the Crystalline Mean, where Katliss awaits, or forgo the steps and take the north passage to reach the Cabinet of Curiosity, and Moren.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Exiting to the south of the aetheryte plaza, meanwhile, will bring you to the markets, overseen by Bragi. The order in which you visit them is entirely up to you, of course.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By focusing your senses, you detect the flow of vastly distant currents of aether. Your connection to these energies is faint but stable, and should allow teleportation to aetherytes in the Source.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Rare to see a place so well stocked with goods, isn't it? But not here.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: I'm going to guess you're new to our fair city?

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Well, for what it's worth, you've chosen a fine sanctuary. The Exarch can throw up a barrier if the sin eaters come knocking, so it's a damn sight safer in here than it is out there.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Safer and more civilized, too─thanks to us in the Mean. We work together to procure materials and resources, and craft the goods which make city life possible. This is the place to visit if you need a coat mended or a kettle forged!

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Just don't go thinking it'll all be handed to you on a plate like those Eulmoran layabouts. Here in the Crystarium, we work for a living.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Though I see you're no stranger to honest labor. You don't have that whiff of indolence about you like some folk I've met. Still, I can't quite pin down your profession... Where is it you're from?

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: ...One of the Exarch's countrymen, you say? ...I see.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Well then, I'll work twice as hard to make you feel welcome! Our city wouldn't even exist if it weren't for him, and any friend of his is a friend of ours!

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: It's really quite incredible when you think about it. They say his grand magicks summoned the Crystal Tower into existence─pulled the entire thing out of thin air.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: It wasn't long before droves of refugees began congregating around its base, desperate for shelter after losing their homes to the Flood...

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: And that's how the Crystarium began. At the Exarch's invitation, buildings started going up, and with the help of some curious relics brought forth from the tower, the place gradually expanded into the thriving metropolis you see today.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: The city's stood here for decades now, yet the eldest among us swear the Exarch looks exactly the same as he did back then...

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: He is indeed a man of many mysteries. But for all his secrecy, he has never yet let us down.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: So if he─and you─wish to remain silent about your shared homeland, then the folk here will respect your wish for privacy.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: ...I am, however, more than a little curious to see any crafting talent you might be hiding! If you've aught to contribute on that front, be sure to come back and visit once you've had a chance to settle in.

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Just ask for Katliss, and I'll find you a niche here in the Crystalline Mean. You can help us keep the cogs of the city greased and turning!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your exchange with Katliss has taught you about “Life in the Crystarium.”

dialogue.name: KATLISS
dialogue.text: Feel free to look around the workshops, but try not to distract the artisans. If they fall behind in their quotas, then everyone suffers for it.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Er, e-excuse me, misssir! Are you recently come to the city, perchance? I'm quite familiar with our civic roles, you see, and...well... Ahem!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Wh-What I mean to ask is, have you brought any books with you!? A rumpled scroll, even? A scrap of scribbled-on parchment...?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: ...My apologies. Literature is something of an obsession of mine. As well as a profession.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Librarian Moren, at your service. And this humble collection is known as the Cabinet of Curiosity.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: As your powers of perception have likely informed you, my colleagues and I are responsible for curating all manner of tomes, documents, and other vehicles for the written word.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: As horrific as the loss of life and land wrought by the Flood unquestionably was, the damage to recorded knowledge was no less catastrophic. We few do all we can to preserve what wisdom survived.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: But tell me, what brings you to the Cabinet today? Looking for any title in particular? Mayhap a spot of academic research!?

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Oho! So you've an interest in modern history? Splendid! A thorough review of recent events can often yield novel perspectives, I quite agree!

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: If you would prefer something visual to accompany the account, then I think I have an illustrated history book for children somewhere... Just a moment, and I'll fetch it for you.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: And here we are. Would you like to pull up a chair? Make yourself more comfortable? ...Ahem, on with the lesson, then.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: A hundred years ago─or near enough not to matter─villains known as the Warriors of Light slew the Shadowkeeper, the steward of Darkness.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: In the wake of this tainted deed, Light began to pour into the world as if from unseen cracks. It pooled and swelled without cease, until the day an enormous, blinding wave rose up and swept across our star.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text:
We called this calamity the “Flood of Light.”
Everything it touched was leeched of life and vigor, leaving naught behind but a luminous wasteland.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Yet just when it seemed that all would be lost, a savior appeared before us...

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: The Oracle of Light. She stood 'twixt us and approaching doom, and by her power did she stay the Flood. Thus was Norvrandt, and Norvrandt alone, spared the fate of erasure.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Tragedy would, however, arrive in another form. From the blasted emptiness descended horrors of strange and terrible aspect to bedevil the few folk who survived.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: These “sin eaters” were Light incarnate, and their fulgent presence stole the night from Norvrandt's sky.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: Even now, they circle the remaining bastions of civilization, ever on the hunt for us, ever hungering for our flesh...

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text:
...And thus did the world become what it is.
Should you ever wish to hear the tale again, I would be glad to retell it for you.

dialogue.name: MOREN
dialogue.text: O-Or if you would rather I speak of other matters, that too would be my pleasure! I should be glad of the company!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your exchange with Moren has taught you about “The Flood of Light.”

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: New to the city, friend? The spinning head and wide eyes give you away.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Welcome. My name is Bragi, and I'm the master of these markets. They gave the district another, official title, but I'm not in the habit of using it. Too florid by half...

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: In any case, our merchants stock a range of equipment for Humes such as yourselfelves such as yourselfMystel such as yourselfGaldjent such as yourselfDrahn such as yourselfRonso like you and meViis such as yourself, so finding something in your size shouldn't be a problem.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: In any case, our merchants stock a wide range of equipment, so we should have something in your size. Forgive my asking, but you are a dwarf, yes? We don't get many of your lot coming down from the mountain these days.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, did you say, “HumeselvesdwarfMystelGaldjentDrahnRonsoViis”...?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Um, I'm actually a Hyuran Elezena Lalafella Miqo'tea Roegadynan Au Raa Hrothgara Viera...

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Aye? Something wrong?

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Hm? Must be a dialect I'm not familiar with.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Let's see if we can straighten this out. See those two in front of us? The shorter one is a Hume, like you.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: And the taller one is an elf, like you.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: That sturdy individual over there is a GaldjentThat fellow over there is a Galdjent, like you...

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: ...whilst the one with the horns is a Drahn, like you.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: And then you have the large, scaly chaps with long tails and a knack for raising livestock. Those would be the Zun.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: ...Which is apparently not the name you know them by. Now I'm curious to know which far-flung region you hail from...

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: ...Which is apparently not what you call them. Do the dwarves have different names for all the peoples of the world? Or did you pick up the common tongue in some other far-flung region...?

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Ah, the same as the Exarch, eh? Well, that explains it.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: You don't get much further-flung than that. We've had a few of your lot pass through in recent years, and despite their obvious learning, they floundered over the simplest things.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: But not to worry! Should you find yourself confused by the local language or customs, I'll be here to answer your questions.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Your exchange with Bragi has taught you about “The Peoples of the First.”

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: I didn't point them out earlier, but I'm sure you'll spot aa fellow Mystel, or another Ronso like meus sooner rather than later. Even Viis like Captain Lynayourself aren't that unusual in this city.

dialogue.name: BRAGI
dialogue.text: Aye, the Crystarium's long been a sanctuary for all manner of refugees─except maybe the dwarves. ThoseYour lot prefer to keep themselves to themselves, in my experience.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Well, how did you fare? Did my colleagues help you form a clearer picture of this world and its people?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Yes, it seems you were treated to a most thorough introduction. I understand it was something of a chore, but 'twas necessary that you grasp these things before we proceed.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: As for the Crystal Tower's origin, you may have noted that details were sparse. The structure is, in fact, the selfsame one you know from the Source, transported to the First in its entirety.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: It was my first attempt at breaching the boundaries between worlds─something of a trial run for your eventual crossing. And although I do not know which era I tore it from, I do know that its arrival served to set the wheels of fate in motion.
